name: Household Capture
description: Turn a messy household message into Notion tasks + optional reminders.
prompt:
Household capture workflow.

Goal
- Turn a messy message into clean tasks and log them to Notion.

Inputs
- Notion database_id: {{notion_database_id}}
- Raw tasks text:
{{tasks}}
- Create reminders: {{create_reminders}}

Steps
1) Parse the raw tasks text into a structured checklist. Infer:
   - Priority (high/medium/low)
   - Due date (if implied)
   - Owner (if mentioned)
2) If "{{notion_database_id}}" is missing or looks invalid, ask me for the database_id and STOP.
3) Create one Notion page per task in that database using notion_action create_page.
   - Put the task title in the Notion title property.
   - If the database supports it, also set properties like due date, status, priority.
4) If create_reminders is true:
   - For tasks with due dates/times, create Apple Reminders via apple_reminders_action (or schedule_task if Reminders is unavailable).
5) Return a concise report:
   - Task list
   - Notion page IDs/URLs
   - Reminder IDs (if created)

Safety
- Ask for approval before creating or modifying external items if the tool requires it.

parameters.name: notion_database_id
parameters.description: Target Notion database_id where tasks should be created

parameters.name: tasks
parameters.description: Paste the raw household tasks text here

parameters.name: create_reminders
parameters.description: Also create reminders for due tasks

routing.useWhen: Use when the user asks to turn a messy household message into Notion tasks + optional reminders.
routing.dontUseWhen: Do not use when the request is asking for planning documents, high-level strategy, or non-executable discussion; use the relevant planning or design workflow instead.
routing.outputs: Outcome from Household Capture: task-specific result plus concrete action notes.
routing.successCriteria: Returns concrete actions and decisions matching the requested task, with no fabricated tool-side behavior.
